question.title: how to run projects which is using idlj and java 17
question.body:
I am using .idl files in my java project .. I used to run that project using java8 but recently as upgrade plan i had upgraded to java17 .. now these idl files are not running in java 17 .. please let me know how to run these files .. i am getting the below errors

{Task :module-plugin:Idl2Java FAILED

idl file present: C:\Users\pc1\server\plugins\mml\idl\ea.idl

>>> cmdline: [idlj, -td, C:\Users\pc1\server\plugins\mml\tmp, -i, C:\Users\pc1\server\plugins\mml\idl, -fall, -fallTIE, C:\Users\pc1\server\plugins\mml\idl\ea.idl]


Execution failed for task ':module-plugin:Idl2Java'.

> A problem occurred starting process 'command 'idlj''

* Exception is:

org.gradle.api.tasks.TaskExecutionException: Execution failed for task ':module-plugin:Idl2Java'.


Caused by: org.gradle.process.internal.ExecException: A problem occurred starting process 'command 'idlj''     

Caused by: net.rubygrapefruit.platform.NativeException: Could not start 'idlj'

Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "idlj" (in directory "C:\Users\pc1\\server\plugins\mml"): CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified

Caused by: java.io.IOException: CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified
}

answers.body:
Common Object Request Broker Architecture (CORBA) support was deprecated in JDK 9, and removed in JDK 11.

  • Java 11 Release Notes
  • JEP 320: Remove the Java EE and CORBA Modules

You have to get a CORBA implementation from somewhere else, maybe here https://www.jacorb.org/, or here https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/orb

question_comments.body: I had read the Releae Note.. but want to know if we want to work with both idl files and java17 how it can be done is my query.. because i had tried with 3rd party jars as well but not working
Always read the Release Notes before upgrading: JEP 320 Remove the Java EE and CORBA Modules

79756709.body: @Prasad Yes, they are! You just need to explicitly include the dependencies in your project, since they're no longer part of "base" java. The details are in the links.
but the  3rd party jars need to be supported for java17 as well
